name: Sylvilagus apollinaris
description: The Bogota tapeti is a species of cottontail rabbit related to the common tapeti. It is endemic to a region south of the Isthmus of Panama, generally described as "northern Colombia". Previously a subspecies of either the common tapeti or Andean tapeti, it was split and considered a separate species in 2017. Later morphological evidence was examined that supported its separation from S. brasilensis.
